Articles.Content:
One day is just thought about making a biplane. As you can tell this isn't a biplane, it kinda took a creative turn for the better in my mind. It is probably a late 20's or 30's fighter, right around that time period. She is a joy to fly, accually quite smooth. To be honest is wasn't expecting much when I made her. I was to much in on the looks. However I got lucky and got a very lovely plane, if I do say so myself. I guess I will let the pictures take over for now.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Now you might be wondering how it takes off. Well it does so how every you want to. Just make sure to take off by 60 m/s. However if you do not take off by then you are in luck. Just leave the seat, right click on the wheel and repair. Your kerbal can then get back in the seat, even while in the air.

Landing is a tricky though. You have to be going fairly slow, less than 60 m/s. Then once you land your SAS and brakes HAS to be on(the plane will flip). If no brakes then no SAS is required. Also dont try turning during landing. Also the Infiniglide glitch is some what present, there is no way I can get around that with out sacrificing agility.

Alright that is pretty much it, no action groups in this one. I hope you enjoy my work and please fly safely.

http://www./view/m81r2f2ack87ygz/AF-4D(3).craft

Edited May 11, 2014 by Jeb Cubed
Looks awesome! I can't quite tell, what's the part clipped into the intake on the front?

Looks awesome! I can't quite tell, what's the part clipped into the intake on the front?

Looks to me like a nosecone.

Looks awesome! I can't quite tell, what's the part clipped into the intake on the front?

Very hard to tell, but I think its the comm dish (in closed position).

Beautiful plane by the way. +1
Yes it is a com dish. I tried the science modals but they were to small. And thank you for the feed back

Those MG's are awesome. Very clever!

Thank you, I hope you like flying it too!

Seeing. Lot of these planes all of a sudden. ;-)

I like this one. Good job mate.

MJ
Working on a sea plane variant, it isn't going to well...
Wow this thing is fast. It gets a bit of infini-asistence I think.

Wow this thing is fast. It gets a bit of infini-asistence I think.

Yes, as I said in the landing portion of the forum. But cruising is not as fast, just when you are doing stunts.
